descriptions: Teams net points while player is on the court.
Teams net points while player is on the court.

article.description: Steve Francis had his fourth triple-double of the season but Moochie Norris drained a key 3-pointer with 27.5 seconds left as the Houston Rockets edged the Boston Celtics, 104-101.
article.headline: Francis posts fourth career triple-double

images.name: Francis, Steve 020118 inline
images.caption: Steve Francis returned from migraine headaches to post the fourth triple-double of his career.

article.linkText: With pain gone, Francis a real headache for Celtics
article.story:
BOSTON (AP) -- Steve Francis' headaches were gone and so were Boston's hopes.
Francis

Francis had his fourth career triple-double after missing the previous game with migraine headaches and the Houston Rockets beat the Celtics 104-101 Friday night "I feel awfully relieved," he said. "I was able to focus on basketball only." When the Celtics focused on Francis, he passed to the open man as Boston struggled against a team that moved the ball crisply and had several 3-point shooters. "We hadn't see one-on-one basketball like that all season, so it was definitely a challenge for us," Boston's Antoine Walker said. Francis had 26 points -- 14 in the fourth quarter -- and added a season-high 15 rebounds and 10 assists. He scored just six points in the first half. Without him on Wednesday night, the Rockets lost to Toronto 109-103. "I wanted to come in and help them do the same thing they were doing" against the Raptors, Francis said. "So I came out passing the ball and playing good defense." Cuttino Mobley had 21 points for Houston and set up Moochie Norris' critical 3-pointer that made the score 100-96 with 27 seconds left. Norris tied his career-high with 28 points as Francis' replacement against Toronto. "Every time I end up being the open man on that play," said Norris, who finished with seven points. "I had a feeling they'd sag off me a little bit." The win was Houston's fourth in 19 road games and ended Boston's three-game winning streak. The Celtics were led by Paul Pierce with 38 points and Walker with 25. Each had 11 rebounds. "They challenge you defensively, the way they spread the court," Pierce said. "They have a lot of really good perimeter shooters. Their record (13-26) doesn't really show how good of a team they are." Houston is 12-9 with Francis but just 1-17 without him. The Rockets hit 12 of 23 shots from 3-point range. Mobley was 5-for-8 and Eddie Griffin, who had 19 points, went 3-for-5. The Celtics led only twice, 20-19 and 42-41, but closed to within 97-95 with four consecutive points. Walker then made one of two free throws, cutting the lead to one with 42 seconds to go. Then Norris hit his basket from the left corner. The Celtics made it 102-101 on Walker's 3-pointer with 5.4 seconds remaining before Francis hit two free throws with 4.9 seconds to go. Pierce then dribbled up court but his desperation 3-point shot went off the rim at the buzzer. "They're a difficult team when Francis is playing for them," Boston coach Jim O'Brien said. "He's a terrific player." Houston scored the first seven points of the game and led 81-70 early in the fourth quarter. It was 97-93 before the Celtics stopped Francis as Tony Battie blocked one of his shots and changed another. Meanwhile, Walker's layup and free throw made it 97-96. With the Celtics watching Francis carefully, the Rockets swung the ball around to Norris for his key 3-pointer. Erick Strickland then made two free throws for Boston but missed a 3-pointer. Two free throws by Francis gave the Rockets a 102-98 lead and Walker's 3-pointer left the Celtics one point short. The Rockets held a 50-44 lead at halftime and extended it to 79-70 after three quarters. Of Boston's 26 points in the period, Pierce had 16, Walker six and Strickland four.

Game notes
Boston's Eric Williams went to the locker room with 1:51 left in the second quarter after rolling his right ankle, and re-entered the game with 7:22 left in the third. He left two minutes later and didn't play again. ... Francis had a triple-double after three quarters with 12 points, 10 rebounds and 10 assists. ... The Celtics' Kenny Anderson started after missing his last game with a strained back. ... Pierce became the first NBA player to score 1,000 points this season with a 16-foot jumper with 1:03 left in the first quarter.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.
